availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward Rumsey Weir, Jr. (Muhlenberg, County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier.)

body.p: Muhlenberg, County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, native. Son of Edward R. Weir and Harriet R. Weir. Married to Eliza Tripplett Johnson Weir in 1864. Father of Frank Weir. Resident of Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Merchant in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A) as a captain from December 9, 1861 to January 9, 1863. Resigned with a certificate of disability on January 9, 1863. Served in the 35th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry as lieutenant colonel from October 2, 1863 to December 29, 1864.
